p: Towards the end of the year 2019, a new variant of Coronaviruses, the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) emerged from East Asia. The SARS-CoV-2 causes respiratory infections of varying disease severity in humans, ranging from asymptomatic to severe cases [ 5]. The virus is transmitted via respiratory droplets and aerosols from both symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals [ 6â€“ 10]. With international travel facilitating the rapid spread of the virus, many countries including those in Africa adopted syndromic screening at ports of entry as a measure to curb its spread, with evidence showing a delay to the onset of outbreaks by a week [ 11]. However, syndromic screening has its own shortfalls given its inadequacies at detecting asymptomatic individuals [ 12].
